arr = np.array(arr)

body:
So `from_numpy` is slow if I do

`torch.from_numpy(arr)`

But `from_numpy` is fast if I do
```
arr = np.array(arr)
torch.from_numpy(arr)
```

Theory: `np.array(arr)` copies things from mmaped area to process local memory area, so from_numpy becomes fast

Running this under cProfile shows that the time is spent under `torch._C.from_numpy`
